description:
This course provides an in-depth review of decision supports systems in the healthcare setting.

Fundamental concepts such as decision analysis, decision science, and knowledge management will be covered. Aspects from designing to implementing and maintain clinical decision support tools will also be discussed in depth. Additionally, the course will cover Bayesian theory, decision trees, patient utilities, quality of life and cost related to health outcomes in order to contextualise clinical decision making. Finally, practical issues such as overcoming barriers to the adoption of clinical decision support tools will also be covered.
title: Clinical Decision Support Systems
faculty: Yong Loo Lin Sch of Medicine
